results.title: Cooperage

results.creator_credit: Justin Milne, Malcolm Smith and South Australian Film Corporation

results.brief_description: Shows the habits and behaviour of domestic pigs, using natural sounds and no narration. Records the faces, personalities, and varied textures of the pigs.

results.title: Can't you bloody-well read?!
results.creator_credit: John Dick, Max Pepper, Pepper Audio Visual and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: A poignant study of adult illiteracy and its effect on the lives of one in ten adults in our community. The Department of Further Education is working on a new program that may provide an answer in the field of reading education. The aim of the film is to remove some of the shame illiterate people in the community feel, and to convince them they should do something about it.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Dick, Max Pepper, Pepper Audio Visual and South Australian Film Corporation

results.title: Yorke Peninsula
results.creator_credit: Ron Saunders and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: The sea in its various moods is the central “character” in this exploration of the scenery and recreational opportunities of Yorke Peninsula in South Australia. The agricultural and mining background of this region adds a further dimension to its natural pleasures.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ron Saunders and South Australian Film Corporation

results.title: Who killed Jenny Langby?
results.creator_credit: Donald Crombie, John Morris and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: An award winning portrayal by director Donald Crombie of a suburban mother who is a victim of the pressures and pace of modern urban life. The domestic situation before and after her suicide are re-created for a dramatic examination of cause and effect. Docu-drama presented as an interview by Anne Deveson.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Donald Crombie, John Morris and South Australian Film Corporation

results.title: Way ahead
results.creator_credit: Robert Walker, Kim Dalton and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: A look at the ever increasing problems of the motor car and its alternative, public transport. New improvements in public transport systems throughout the world are examined. Other new ideas, still in the planning stages, are also shown. Animation is ;used to show a possible futurisitic solution of personalised rapid transit. Cinematography by John Leake.

results.title: A Taste of Adelaide
results.creator_credit: Ron Way and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: An award-winning film of some of Adelaide’s fine restaurants and hotels; a tour laced together with delightful glimpses into some of the colourful, charming, little-known and well-known aspects of this unspoiled, unhurried city.

results.title: Safe driving: a question of attitude
results.creator_credit: Max Pepper, Peter Dimond, Pepper Audio Visual and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: In a series of dramatised sequences the importance of developing sensible attitudes to driving a motor vehicle is clearly presented. Aggressive and timid drivers, speeding away from traffic lights, poor driving techniques, “tailgating” and drink-driving are all dealt with.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Max Pepper, Peter Dimond, Pepper Audio Visual and South Australian Film Corporation
